jacksomeone,

Stop lying. What you have uploaded is the same trial stuff on Sony's website.

All you have done is renamed the files. They are the same sizes and checksum as the trials.

Well, this is what I got on a Checksum checker...

dvdarchitectpro45-trial_enu.exe D762BD9A7D00F3647D0147947E6747B1
dvdarchitectpro45_enu.exe 88DD7311A3F718D646FD10BCE0C6F7E1
vegaspro80-trial_enu.exe 4B5784C6A762476A22B149E29C2325C4
vegaspro80_enu.exe FF55C5E354B96FD0E1D9E9D990668EAC

Got the same result twice.

and the size IS different: 

Vegas Trial: 76,110,800 bytes

Vegas Full: 76,110,720 bytes

DVD Architect Trial: 68,309,160 bytes

DVD Architect Full: 68,309,056 bytes

80 bytes and 104 bytes IS the difference between Trial and Full since the install data is heavily compressed.

Furthermore, the Digital Signature Signing times are different:

Vegas Trial: Signed August 21, 2007 11:59:06 AM

Vegas Full: Signed August 21, 2007 11:59:10 AM

DVD Architect Trial: July 16, 2007 4:37:29 PM

DVD Architect Full: July 16, 2007 4:37:25 PM

Unless you have more evidence, they're not the same.

Ok, I might've figured out why Vegas 8 is so hard to make a keygen or crack...

Vegas 7 had unencrypted and unsigned core files therefore making it easy to crack, but Vegas 8 and DVD Architect 4.5 are encrypted.
